antegenitalis: <entryFree id="n2757" type="hapax" key="ante^ge^ni^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-gĕnĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n2757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before birth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">experimentum antegenitale,</quote> <trans><tr>of that which was before our birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 190</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antegestus: <entryFree id="n2758" type="main" key="ante^gestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um, better written separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ante gestus</orth>, v. ante and gero.</entryFree>
antegredior: <entryFree id="n2759" type="main" key="ante^gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>-gradior</etym>, <sense id="n2759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to precede</hi> (perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">stella Veneris cum antegreditur solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid est quod deceat, id tum adparet, cum antegressa est honestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 14</bibl>. <cb n="ANTE" /></sense></entryFree>
antehabeo: <entryFree id="n2760" type="hapax" key="ante^ha^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-hăbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilia veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antehac: <entryFree id="n2761" type="main" key="ante^ha_c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-hāc</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdhāc</orth>, <itype>like antidea for antea, and antideo for anteeo</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 7</bibl>.—Antehac, dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 5</bibl>) [v. antea], <sense id="n2761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before this</hi> (present) <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aforetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously</hi> (demonstr.; on the contr. antea, before any fixed time, rel.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">antea): quod antehac imperitabam, nunc te oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis me benigne nunc salutas, quam antidhac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antehac sperare saltem licebat, nunc etiam id ereptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque antehac flagitiis, ita tunc legibus laborabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes for antea (rel.), <hi rend="ital">before any specified time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earlier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before that time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam hic quidem omnem imaginem meam, quae antehac fuerat, possidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea saepe antehac fidem prodiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anteidea: <entryFree id="n2762" type="main" key="anteide^a_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anteidĕā</orth> = antidea, v. antea.</entryFree>
antelatus: <entryFree id="n2763" type="main" key="ante^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of antefero.</entryFree>
antelii: <entryFree id="n2764" type="greek" key="Ante_li^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antēlĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Anthēlĭi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anth/lioi</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)anqh/lioi</foreign>, <sense id="n2764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">images of gods that stood before the house door</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antelogium: <entryFree id="n2765" type="hapax" key="ante^lo^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕlŏgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hybrida, from ante-<foreign lang="greek">lo/gos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n2765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prologue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preamble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Huic argumento antelogium quidem hoc fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anteloquium: <entryFree id="n2766" type="main" key="ante^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-lŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>loquor</etym> (postclass. and rare). <sense id="n2766.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The right of speaking before another</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2766.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preface</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:23" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antelucanus: <entryFree id="n2767" type="main" key="ante^lu_ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-lūcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n2767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before day</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">only in prose): ex antelucano tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta roris antelucani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <trans><tr>which continue the whole night until daybreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus, i. e. ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕlūcā-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dawn</hi> (eccl. Lat.): doctrinam quasi antelucanum illumino omnibus, <hi rend="ital">I make to shine as the dawn</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:24:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 24, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antelucio: <entryFree id="n2768" type="main" key="ante^lu_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-lūcĭo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before daybreak</hi> (only in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">aufugere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 8</bibl></cit> Elm.: <cit><quote lang="la">recubare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 223, 30.</sense></entryFree>
anteluculo: <entryFree id="n2769" type="hapax" key="ante^lu_cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-lūcŭlo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before daybreak</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 36</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
anteludium: <entryFree id="n2770" type="hapax" key="ante^lu_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-lūdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ludo</etym>, <sense id="n2770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prelude</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 31</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
antemeridialis: <entryFree id="n2771" type="hapax" key="ante^me^ri_di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-mĕrīdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (a rare form for the foll.), <sense id="n2771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before mid-day</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, p. 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antemeridianus: <entryFree id="n2772" type="main" key="ante^me^ri_di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-mĕrīdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n2772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before mid-day</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>received before mid-day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antemitto: <entryFree id="n2773" type="main" key="ante^mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-mitto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send on</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">for praemittere): equitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">antemissis equitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antemnae: <entryFree id="n2774" type="main" key="Antemnae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antemnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> Antemna, Cato. Orig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 716</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:367" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 367</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of the Sabines</hi>, so called from its situation on the river (ante amnem; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Interamna) Anio, where it empties into the Tiber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 28</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 631</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>; and Mann. Ital. 1, 662.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">An-temnās</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Antemnœ;</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Antemnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antemoenio: <entryFree id="n2775" type="hapax" key="ante^moeni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-moenĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>munio</etym>, <sense id="n2775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish with a front</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protecting wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to provide with a rampart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antemoeni aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 68</bibl></cit> dub. (Ritschl, anteveni; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
antemurale: <entryFree id="n2776" type="main" key="ante^mu_ra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-mūrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n2776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a protecting wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an outwork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breastwork</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Hom. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus et antemurale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxitque antemurale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Thren. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antemuranus: <entryFree id="n2777" type="hapax" key="ante^mu_ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-mūrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n2777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is before the wall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22</bibl></cit> (12).</sense></entryFree>
antenna: <entryFree id="n2778" type="main" key="antenna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antenna</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">antemna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin <cb n="ANTE" /> to <foreign lang="greek">a)natei/nw</foreign>, acc. to Doed.</etym>, <sense id="n2778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sail-yard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes, qui antemnas ad malos destinabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis antemnisque de nave in navem trajectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: antemnae gemunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Effugit hibernas demissa antemna procellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua velatarum antemnarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the ends of the sail-yards covered with the sails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 549</bibl></cit>.—As pars pro toto = velum: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus ... antemnis apta ferendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 783</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antenor: <entryFree id="n2779" type="main" key="Ante_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antēnor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anth/nwr</foreign>. <sense id="n2779.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A noble Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was in favor of restoring Helen and making peace with the Greeks; after the fall of Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he went to Italy and founded Patavium</hi> (Padua), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n2779.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n2779.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Antēnŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Antenor;</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">Patavian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Paduan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:25" default="NO">4, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2779.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Antēnŏrĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Antenor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 484</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>an inhabitant of Padua</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antenuptialis: <entryFree id="n2780" type="main" key="ante^nupti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-nuptĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n2780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">before marriage</hi> (only in late Lat.), Justin. Novell. 2, 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
anteoccupatio: <entryFree id="n2781" type="main" key="anteoccu^pa_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anteoccŭpātio</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">anteoccŭpo</orth>, <itype>better separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ante occŭpātio</orth>, etc.</entryFree>
antepaenultimus: <entryFree id="n2782" type="main" key="ante^paenulti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-paenultĭmus</orth> (less correctly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">-pēn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; <sense id="n2782.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in gram.,</quote> <trans><tr>pertaining to the third syllable from the end</tr>, <tr>antepenultimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 425</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, p. 60 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
antepagmentum: <entryFree id="n2783" type="main" key="ante^pagmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pagmentum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭp-</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pango</etym>; in archit., <sense id="n2783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">every thing that is used for garnishing the exterior of a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the ornaments about the doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windows</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll.; Müll. Archaeol. § 287.</sense></entryFree>
anteparo: <entryFree id="n2784" type="main" key="ante^pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕpăro</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕpartus</orth>, <itype>more correctly</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ păro</orth>, etc.</entryFree>
antepassio: <entryFree id="n2785" type="hapax" key="ante^passi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-passĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">propa/qeia</foreign>, <sense id="n2785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presentiment of pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 97</bibl> ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antependulus: <entryFree id="n2786" type="main" key="ante^pendu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pendŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n2786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging before</hi> (only late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125, 4</bibl></cit> Elm.; 5, p. 168, 23 Elm.</sense></entryFree>
antepereo: <entryFree id="n2787" type="main" key="ante^pe^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕpĕrĕo</orth>, more correctly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ pĕrĕo</orth>.</entryFree>
antepes: <entryFree id="n2788" type="main" key="ante^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> * <sense id="n2788.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The forefoot</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=454" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 454</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2788.1" n="II" level="1"> = anteambulo, <hi rend="ital">a forerunner</hi>, etc., Agroet. Orthogr. p. 2274 P. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 143</bibl>, the correct read. is <hi rend="ital">ante pedes</hi>, Jahn).</sense></entryFree>
antepilanus: <entryFree id="n2789" type="main" key="ante^pi_la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pīlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n2789.0" n="I" level="1"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n2789.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The soldiers who fought before the</hi> pilani, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the hastati and the principes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2789.2" n="B" level="2"> In Ammianus, = antesignanus, <hi rend="ital">one who fought before the standards</hi>, 16, 12, 20. —</sense><sense id="n2789.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a competitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rival</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antepolleo: <entryFree id="n2790" type="main" key="ante^polle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pollĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n2790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be more powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 20</bibl></cit> Elm.: <cit><quote lang="la">toto vertice cunctos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 189, 35 Elm.</sense></entryFree>
antepono: <entryFree id="n2791" type="main" key="ante^po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsui, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2791.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum locos sedilibus plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propugnacula anteposita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 56</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n2791.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> (<hi rend="ital">food</hi>) <hi rend="ital">before one</hi> (com., pono, as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:141 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 141 al.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">prandium pransoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2791.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give the preference to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe Academiae illi hoc gymnasium anteponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo generi meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam omnibus rebus humanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 69</bibl>.← <cit><quote lang="la">With tmesis: pono ante: mala bo nis ponit ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antepotens: <entryFree id="n2792" type="hapax" key="ante^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n2792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superior in power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatibus gaudiisque antepotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antequam: <entryFree id="n2793" type="main" key="ante^quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕquam</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ quam</orth>, v. ante, II. B. 2.</entryFree>
anterides: <entryFree id="n2794" type="greek" key="ante_ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antērĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nthri/des</foreign>; <sense id="n2794.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in archit.,</quote> <trans><tr>counter-props set against a wall to support it</tr>, <tr>a buttress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anteridion: <entryFree id="n2795" type="greek" key="ante_ri^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antērĭdĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n2795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dim. n.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nthri/dion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a little prop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
anterior: <entryFree id="n2796" type="main" key="ante^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <sense id="n2796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comp.</hi> [ante] (only in late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">that is before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foremost</hi>: pars. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 3</bibl>.—Of time, <hi rend="ital">previous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anterior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>, <pb n="131" /> <cb n="ANTE" /> 59: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 1, 52 al.</bibl></cit>— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕrĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anteros: <entryFree id="n2797" type="greek" key="Ante^ro_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĕrōs</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ante/rws</foreign> (an opponent of Eros) <sense id="n2797.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An avenger of slighted love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2797.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of amethyst</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2797.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antes: <entryFree id="n2798" type="main" key="antes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. unc., perh. from ante, as before, over against, one another</etym>, <sense id="n2798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rows</hi>, e. g. of vines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 417</bibl>, cf. Paul. ex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 16</bibl> Müll.—Also of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:376" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 376</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">ranks</hi> of soldiers, Cato ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 417</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antescholanus: <entryFree id="n2799" type="hapax" key="ante^scho^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-schŏlānus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>schola</etym>, <sense id="n2799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of teacher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antescolarius: <entryFree id="n2800" type="main" key="antesco^la_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antescŏlārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, same as foregoing: <sense id="n2800.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ANTE SCOLARIS VIRGINVM (Vestalium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antesignanus: <entryFree id="n2801" type="main" key="ante^signa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-signānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>signum</etym>, <sense id="n2801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is before the standard;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n2801.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">antesignant (sc. milites),</quote> <trans><tr>a chosen band of Roman soldiers who fought before the standards</tr>, <tr>and served for their defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 553, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2801.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in acie Pharsalicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antesto: <entryFree id="n2802" type="main" key="antesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ante-sto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">anti-sto</orth>, <itype>stĕti, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n2802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand before</hi>, only in a trop. signif., <hi rend="ital">to excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior to;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica, quae omnibus holeribus antistat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crotoniatae omnibus corporum viribus et dignitatibus antestiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 12</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto antestaret eloquentia innocentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 2</bibl></cit> Halm: virtute ceteris, Claud, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13</bibl>: aliquem, Met. Numid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scandinavia magnitudine alias (insulas) antestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: Herculis antistare si facta putabis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 22</bibl> Lachm.</sense></entryFree>
antestor: <entryFree id="n2803" type="main" key="antestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antestor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n2803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep</hi> [acc. to Corssen, Ausspr. II. p. 564, from an-, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)na/</foreign>, as in anhelo, q. v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and testor; acc. to others, from ante and testor], a word peculiar to judicial proceedings, <hi rend="ital">to call up as a witness before the opening of the cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call as a witness</hi> (the formula was: licet antestari? and the person gave his assent by offering the tip of his ear, which the summoner touched; cf. Smith, Dict. Antiq.); so in 1 Fragm. in XII. Tab.: SI. IN. IVS. VOCAT. NI. IT. ANTESTATOR. IGITVR. EM. CAPITO: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Licet te antestari? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Non licet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 10</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 60</bibl>: magnā Inclamat voce, et <hi rend="ital">Licet antestari?</hi> Ego vero Oppono auriculam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in aure imā memoriae locus, quem tangentes antestamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:45:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103</bibl></cit>.—In Cic. once, in gen. sense, not pertaining to judic. proceedings: te, magne, antestaretur, quod nunc etiam facit, Mil. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—In a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">antestātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a witness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anteurbana: <entryFree id="n2804" type="gloss" key="ante^urba_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕurbāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: anteurbana: praedia urbi propinqua, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
antevenio: <entryFree id="n2805" type="main" key="ante_ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antē-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n2805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the start of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2805.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> (cf. Rudd. II. p. 137): <cit><quote lang="la">temport,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit> (tempus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 23, 152</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia et insidias (hostium),</quote> <trans><tr>to thwart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: omni tempore anteventum est, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2805.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">amor omnibus rebus antevenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per virtutem nobilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become greater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia, ubi multum antevenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anteventulus: <entryFree id="n2806" type="main" key="ante^ventu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-ventŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venio</etym>, <sense id="n2806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coming before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging before</hi>, = antependulus (perh. only in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 231, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 3, p. 342, 2</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
anteversio: <entryFree id="n2807" type="hapax" key="ante^versi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>anteverto</etym>, <sense id="n2807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anticipating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preventing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anteversio et praegressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
anteverto: <entryFree id="n2808" type="main" key="ante^verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-verto</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vor-</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (as <sense id="n2808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep</hi> antevortar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 5, 1</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to place one's self before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to precede.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2808.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerores antevortunt gaudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella tum antevertens, tum subsequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque antevertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 17</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="ANTH" /> </sense><sense id="n2808.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2808.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To anticipate</hi>: miror, ubi ego huic antevorterim, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Fannius antevertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationem veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2808.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prefer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus aliis antevortar, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar omnibus consiliis antevertendum existimavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl></cit> (where omnibus consiliis are not, as Herz. ad h. l. supposes, the <case>abl.</case>, but analog. to rebus aliis in the preced. example, in the <case>dat.</case>, e. g.: prae omnibus aliis consiliis id efficiendum existimavit ut, etc., Fr.).</sense></entryFree>
antevio: <entryFree id="n2809" type="main" key="ante^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-vĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>via</etym>, <sense id="n2809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, Ven. Fort. 4, 26.</sense></entryFree>
antevolo: <entryFree id="n2810" type="main" key="ante^vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n2810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly before;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (only post-Aug.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 47</bibl>, and 12, 455 Rib., it is written apart, ante volo): <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:427" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:600" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Phoen. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antevorta: <entryFree id="n2811" type="main" key="Ante^vorta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĕ-vorta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n2811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a goddess who reminds men of things past</hi> (opp. Postvorta), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:633" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 633</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 336</bibl>, called Porrima).</sense></entryFree>
anthalium: <entryFree id="n2812" type="greek" key="antha^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthălĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqa/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n2812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bulbous esculent root</hi>: Cyperus esculentus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthedon: <entryFree id="n2813" type="greek" key="anthe_don1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthēdon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqhdw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n2813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the medlar-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Greek medlar</hi>: Mespilus tanacetifolia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 20, 22, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2814" type="main" key="Anthe_don2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthēdon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anqhdw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n2814.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town and harbor in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite the island Eubœa</hi> (hence called Euboica), <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Glaucus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and noted for its great traffic in sponges</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Paleo-kastro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:905" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 905</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 232</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gr. 220.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthēdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Anthedonic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:291" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 291</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 328</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2814.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maritime town in Palestine</hi>, afterwards called <hi rend="ital">Agrippias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2814.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A port on the Saronic Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Argolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthemis: <entryFree id="n2815" type="greek" key="anthe^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthĕmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqemi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb chamomile</hi>: Anthemis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthemum: <entryFree id="n2816" type="greek" key="anthe^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthĕmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqemon</foreign>, <sense id="n2816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb good for calculi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 55, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthemus: <entryFree id="n2817" type="main" key="Anthe^mu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthĕmūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anqemou=s</foreign>. <sense id="n2817.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A region in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n2817.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Mesopotamia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthĕmūsĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype> (sc. urbs), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2817.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Colchis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 5, 5, § 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthĕ-mūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Anthemus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthemusia: <entryFree id="n2818" type="main" key="Anthe^mu_sia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthĕmūsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">An-themus</orth>, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
anthemusa: <entryFree id="n2819" type="main" key="Anthe^mu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthĕmūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old name of the island of Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 37, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthera: <entryFree id="n2820" type="greek" key="anthe_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqhra/</foreign> (blooming), <sense id="n2820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine composed of flowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 42, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthericos: <entryFree id="n2821" type="greek" key="anthe^ri^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthĕrĭcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqe/rikos</foreign>, <sense id="n2821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stalk of the asphodel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:67" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 32, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthias: <entryFree id="n2822" type="greek" key="anthi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n2822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish unknown to us</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was difficult to catch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 59, 85, § 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthinus: <entryFree id="n2823" type="greek" key="anthi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqino/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gathered from flowers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anthologica: <entryFree id="n2824" type="greek" key="antho^lo^gi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthŏlŏgĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqologika/</foreign>, <sense id="n2824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anthology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a work consisting of choice thoughts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proverbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poems</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthracias: <entryFree id="n2825" type="greek" key="anthra^ci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrăcĭas</orth>, v. anthracitis.</entryFree>
anthracinus: <entryFree id="n2826" type="greek" key="anthra^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqra)kinos</foreign>, <sense id="n2826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coal-black</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 550, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthracites: <entryFree id="n2827" type="greek" key="anthra^ci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrăcītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqraki/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n2827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of blood-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthracitis: <entryFree id="n2828" type="greek" key="anthra^ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrăcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqraki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n2828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of carbuncle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the coal-carbuncle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 27, § 99</bibl>; in <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> called <orth extent="full" lang="la">an-thrăcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqraki/as</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
anthrax: <entryFree id="n2829" type="greek" key="anthrax1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqrac</foreign> (coal). <sense id="n2829.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Natural cinnabar</hi> (the color of which is like a burning coal), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2829.1" n="II" level="1"> In medic., <hi rend="ital">a virulent ulcer</hi> (in pure Lat., carbunculus), Aem. Macr. de Herb. c. de Sabina.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2830" type="main" key="Anthrax2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anthrax</orth>. <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/anqrac</foreign>, <sense id="n2830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthriscus: <entryFree id="n2831" type="greek" key="anthriscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <cb n="ANTI" /> <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqriskon</foreign>, <sense id="n2831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southern chervil</hi>: Scandix australis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthropographos: <entryFree id="n2832" type="greek" key="anthro_po_^gra^pho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrōpō^grăphŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqrwpogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n2832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">portrait-painter</hi>, an epithet of the painter Dionysius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthropolatra: <entryFree id="n2833" type="greek" key="anthro_po^la_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrōpŏlā^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqrwpola/trhs</foreign>, <sense id="n2833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man-worshipper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthropomorphitae: <entryFree id="n2834" type="greek" key="anthro_po^morphi_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrōpŏmorphītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqrwpomorfi=tai</foreign>, <sense id="n2834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heretics that attributed to God a human form</hi>, Aug. Haeres. ad Quod vult Deum.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrōpŏmor-phītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">professing the error of such heretics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeresis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anthropophagus: <entryFree id="n2835" type="greek" key="anthro_po^pha^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthrōpŏphăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqrwpofa/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n2835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man-eater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 20, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 30, 35, § 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthus: <entryFree id="n2836" type="greek" key="anthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/nqos</foreign> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">to\ a)/nqos</foreign> = blossom, brilliancy), <sense id="n2836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the yellow wagtail</hi>: Motacilla flava, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 57, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:1206" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 74, 95, § 1206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthyllion: <entryFree id="n2837" type="greek" key="anthylli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthyllĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqu/llion</foreign>, <sense id="n2837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, acc. to Sprengel, <hi rend="ital">the Cretan pitchplant</hi>: Cressa Cretica, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 51, § 84</bibl> (called in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 99, 103, § 175</bibl>, also anthyllum).</sense></entryFree>
anthyllis: <entryFree id="n2838" type="greek" key="anthyllis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthyllis</orth>, ïdis, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqulli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, acc. to Sprengel, <hi rend="ital">the musk-ivy</hi>: Teucrium iva, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anthypophora: <entryFree id="n2839" type="greek" key="anthy^po^pho^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anthypŏphŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nqupofora/</foreign>, <sense id="n2839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhetorical figure in which one anticipates the arguments of his antagonist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and refutes them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 7</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 106</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 87</bibl>, written as Greek, Halm).</sense></entryFree>
antiae: <entryFree id="n2840" type="main" key="antiae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 20</bibl> P.) [ante], <sense id="n2840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hair growing upon the forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forelock;</hi> of Apollo, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 342, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of lions,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>; of the hair of women, Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 15 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
antianus: <entryFree id="n2841" type="main" key="Anti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĭānus, Antĭas</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Antĭātīnus</orth>, v. Antium.</entryFree>
antibacchius: <entryFree id="n2842" type="greek" key="anti^bacchi_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭbacchīus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntibakxei= os</foreign>. <sense id="n2842.0" n="I" level="1"> Pes, <hi rend="ital">a poetical foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the antibacchus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reversed Bacchius</hi>, ˘¯¯ <cit><quote lang="la">(e. g. nĕpō tēs),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2414" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2414</bibl></cit> P. (acc. to other ¯¯˘).—</sense><sense id="n2842.1" n="II" level="1"> Versus, <hi rend="ital">a verse composed of this foot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 513</bibl> P.; called palimbac chius by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 16, p. 30</bibl> Lind.</sense></entryFree>
antibasis: <entryFree id="n2843" type="greek" key="anti^ba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭbăsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">antĕb-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/basis</foreign> (counter-basis), <sense id="n2843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hindmost small pillar at the pedestal of the ballista</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antiboreus: <entryFree id="n2844" type="greek" key="anti^bo^re_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭbŏrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntibo/reios</foreign>, <sense id="n2844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned toward the north</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horologium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
anticategoria: <entryFree id="n2845" type="greek" key="anti^ca^te_go^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭcătēgŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntikathgori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recrimination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counter-plea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 3</bibl>: contra Cresc. 26; 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl>, and 7, 2, 9, written as Greek, Halm).</sense></entryFree>
anticato: <entryFree id="n2846" type="main" key="Anti^ca^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĭcăto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of Cœsar's reply to Cicero's panegyric of Cato Uticensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of which was</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cato</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:337" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16</bibl>; cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. 267 and 462; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 182, 7.</sense></entryFree>
antichristus: <entryFree id="n2847" type="greek" key="Anti_^christus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antī^christus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anti/xristos</foreign>, <sense id="n2847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Antichrist</hi> (eccl. Lat.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,023:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Joan. 2, 18</bibl>; 2, 22; 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,024:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Joan. 7</bibl>; very freq. in the Church fathers.</sense></entryFree>
antichthones: <entryFree id="n2848" type="greek" key="antichtho^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antichthŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/xqones</foreign>, = antipodes (<foreign lang="greek">a)nti/po/des</foreign>), <sense id="n2848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the antipodes</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9" default="NO">1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anticipatio: <entryFree id="n2849" type="main" key="anti^ci^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭcĭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>anticipo</etym>. <sense id="n2849.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preconception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the innate notion of a thing formed before receiving instruction concerning it</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyis</foreign> (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive anticipatio sive praenotio deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2849.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The first movements of the body before walking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2849.2" n="III" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipation</hi> = occupatio and <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyis</foreign>, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> p. 30</bibl> Pith.</sense></entryFree>
anticipo: <entryFree id="n2850" type="main" key="anti^ci^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭ-cĭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ante-capio</etym>. <sense id="n2850.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take before</hi> one or <hi rend="ital">before</hi> the time, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi> something. </sense><sense id="n2850.1" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:76:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 76, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 78, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita est informatum anticipatumque mentibus nostris, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>already known</tr>, <tr>innate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 76</bibl></cit> (cf. anticipatio; <cit><quote lang="la">B. and K. here reject anticipatumque): qui anticipes ejus rei molestiam, quam triduo sciturus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anticipata via,</quote> <trans><tr>travelled over before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculares anticipati (i. e. justo maturius editi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2850.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (eccl. <pb n="132" /> <cb n="ANTI" /> Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">anticipemus facere pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2850.3" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol Anticipat caelum radiis accendere temptans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 658</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 70, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti uno die anticipantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n2850.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus acumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 69</bibl></cit> (by conj. of Salmas.).</sense></entryFree>
anticlea: <entryFree id="n2851" type="main" key="Anticle_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anticlēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)antiklei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 201" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 24, p. 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 529</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">in Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erroneously put for the nurse of Ulysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Euryclea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anticus: <entryFree id="n2852" type="main" key="anti_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ante</etym>, <sense id="n2852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foremost</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">antica (pars) ad meridiem, postica ad septentrionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 7</bibl></cit> Müll.: pars, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anticyra: <entryFree id="n2853" type="main" key="Anti^cy^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĭcyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anti/kirra</foreign>, Dicaearch. and Strabo; <foreign lang="greek">*)anti/kurra</foreign>, Eustath.; and <foreign lang="greek">*)anti/kura</foreign>, which the Romans followed. <sense id="n2853.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on a peninsula</hi> (which Pliny and Gellius erroneously call an island), <hi rend="ital">on a bay of the Corinthian Gulf</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Aspra Spitia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for hellebore;</hi> hence much frequented by hypochondriacs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 18</bibl>; 32, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 64, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:52" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 21, § 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2853.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the Sinus Maliacus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also noted for hellebore</hi>, but less famous than the foregoing; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2853.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Locris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the entrance of the Corinthian Gulf</hi>, often confounded with the Anticyra in Phocis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 26</bibl> (Hor., A. P. 300, speaks as if all three places produced hellebore: tribus Anticyris Caput insanabile; and the <number>plur.</number> Anticyrae, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 16</bibl>, may be used in the same way, or the form may be here a mere poetic exaggeration; v. Gildersleeve ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
antidactylus: <entryFree id="n2854" type="greek" key="anti^dacty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdactylus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntida/ktulos</foreign>: pes, <sense id="n2854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reversed dactyl</hi>, ˘˘¯ (e. g. lĕgĕrēnt), Mar. Vict. p. 2488 P.</sense></entryFree>
antidea: <entryFree id="n2855" type="main" key="anti^de^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdĕa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">anteĭdĕa</orth>, v. antea.</entryFree>
antideo: <entryFree id="n2856" type="main" key="anti^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdĕo</orth>, v. anteeo <sense id="n2856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
antidhac: <entryFree id="n2857" type="main" key="anti^dhac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdhac</orth>, v. antehac <sense id="n2857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
antidotum: <entryFree id="n2858" type="greek" key="anti^do^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdŏtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. Comp. 99:106" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. Comp. 99, 106</bibl>, and passages cited there), = <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/doton</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">-os</foreign>), <sense id="n2858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counterpoison.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2858.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidota raro, sed interdum necessaria sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se antidotum daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35</bibl>.—Sometimes, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an antidote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2858.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidotum adversus Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antiensis: <entryFree id="n2859" type="main" key="Antiensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antiensis</orth>, v. Antium.</entryFree>
antigerio: <entryFree id="n2860" type="greek" key="antigerio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antigerio</orth>, <itype>an ancient word for valde</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll. [perh. antegero]; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:25" default="NO">8, 3, 25</bibl>.</entryFree>
antignotus: <entryFree id="n2861" type="main" key="Antigno_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antignōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)anti/gnwtos</foreign>, <sense id="n2861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artist that cast statues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antigone: <entryFree id="n2862" type="main" key="Anti^go^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĭgŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĭgŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)antigonh</foreign>. <sense id="n2862.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of the Theban king Œdipus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 72" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antigones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:228" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2862.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of the Trojan king Laomedon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antigonen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 320</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antigonea: <entryFree id="n2863" type="main" key="Anti^go^ne_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĭgŏnēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)antigo/neia</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)antigoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several towns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2863.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 23</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">An-tĭgŏnensis</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 23</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">An-tĭgŏnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4</bibl>, praef. 1, 1.—</sense><sense id="n2863.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2863.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n2863.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Troas</hi>, afterwards called <hi rend="ital">Alexandria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
