<cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Verg.: caelum stellis fulgentibus aptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 202</bibl></cit>, and: <cit><quote lang="la">axis stellis ardentibus aptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veste signis ingentibus aptā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis apta figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 814</bibl></cit>: lucus opacus teneris fruticibus aptus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 235, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio prodeat apta sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 70</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3037.4" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">aptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, pr., <hi rend="ital">fitted</hi> to something; hence, <hi rend="ital">suited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apposite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conformable to</hi> (cf. accommodatus and appositus, 2.). </sense><sense id="n3037.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: aptus is, qui convenienter alicui junctus est, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. apex, p. 18 Müll. (so most freq. after the Cic. per.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dat.;</hi> of persons always with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n3037.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa habent commissuras ad stabilitatem aptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pulmonibus inest raritas quaedam ad hauriendum spiritum aptissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ad insidias aptior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei habiles et apti ad pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra ad bellum ducendum aptissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 7, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 26, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptum ad proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornices in muro erant apti ad excurrendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:23:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 23, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3037.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia rebus sunt omnibus apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:961" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 961</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis alias animantibus aptas Res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia apta et accommodata naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:17:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verum, simplex sincerumque sit, id esse naturae hominis aptissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec genera dicendi aptiora sunt adulescentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 223</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 62, 326</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 22, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aetati tuae esset aptissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apta dies sacrificio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti aptiores Romanae quam suae classi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 37 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notavi portus puppibus aptos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 596</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis apta magis tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:22:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 22, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptum equis Argos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apta vinculo conjugali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 9, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptus amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.— Other constrr.: </sense><sense id="n3037.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (cf. Rudd. II. p. 96, n. 60): <cit><quote lang="la">in quod (genus pugnae) minime apti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formas deus aptus in omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>apt for</tr>, <tr>easily changed into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ceteros apta usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 20, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa apta in interitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3037.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">qui</hi> (cf. Zumpt, § <cit><quote lang="la">568): nulla videbatur aptior persona, quae de illā aetate loqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi, quae lanas molliat, apta manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Circe) apta cantu veteres mutare figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas mollis et apta regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— Esp. freq., (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 235, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:22:42" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 22, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apta oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lar aptus,</quote> <trans><tr>an extensive</tr>, <tr>satisfying possession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 43</bibl></cit>.—So in prose: <cit><quote lang="la">aptus exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>an army good in fight</tr>, <tr>ready for battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus aptum,</quote> <trans><tr>the right time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:20:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 20, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3037.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhet., of the fitness, appropriateness of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">quid aptum sit, hoc est quid maxime decens in oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 210</bibl></cit>; so apta oratio, which has the appropriate rhet. fulness and periodic rounding: numerosa et apta <cb n="APOD" /> oratio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 50, 168</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 70</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides verbis aptus et pressus,</quote> <trans><tr>exact and brief in expression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">aptē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nicely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3037.11" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3037.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ita apte cohaeret (mundi corpus), ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 5</bibl></cit>: altera est nexa cum superiore et inde apteque pendens, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 235, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiti apte reponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3037.13" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apte convenire ad pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 46</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n3037.14" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter se quam aptissime cohaereant extrema (verba) cum primis etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3037.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3037.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile judicabimus, quid eorum apte fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est oratoris proprium, apte, distincte, ornate dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apte et quiete ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non equite apte locato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui doceant, apte quid tibi possit emi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliter imperium apte regi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floribus compositis apte et utiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualia aptius suis referentur locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 62, 62, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aptius haec puero, quam tibi, dona dabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3037.17" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid exierit numeris aptius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:12:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 12, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seruntur Parilibus tamen aptissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 24, § 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3037.18" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ut) ad rerum dignitatem apte et quasi decore (loquamur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia ducis hostium caesi suspensa fabricato ad id apte ferculo gerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apocalypsis: <entryFree id="n3038" type="greek" key="a^po^ca^lypsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcălypsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poka/luyis</foreign>, <sense id="n3038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disclosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revelation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">apocalypsim habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apocalypsis Jesu Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Joannis,</quote> <trans><tr>the Revelation</tr>, <tr>the Apocalypse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apocarteresis: <entryFree id="n3039" type="greek" key="a^po^carte^re_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcartĕrēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pokarte/rhsis</foreign>, <sense id="n3039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a voluntary starvation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 23</bibl>, written as Greek, Halm; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 84</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
apocatastasis: <entryFree id="n3040" type="greek" key="a^po^ca^tasta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcătastăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pokata/stasis</foreign>, <sense id="n3040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoring to a former position;</hi> in astronomy, <hi rend="ital">the return of the stars to their position of the preceding year</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Ascl. 84, 6</bibl> Elm. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
apocatastaticus: <entryFree id="n3041" type="greek" key="a^po^ca^tasta^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcătastătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pokatastatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">returning</hi>: Mars, <hi rend="ital">to the position of the previous year</hi> (cf. apocatastasis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apocha: <entryFree id="n3042" type="greek" key="a^po^cha^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏchă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n3042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the receipt of a creditor acknowledging the payment of a debt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apocha non alias contingit quam si pecunia soluta sit,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no receipt till the money is paid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:27" default="NO">47, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:67:section=3" default="NO">12, 6, 67, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apocleti: <entryFree id="n3043" type="greek" key="A^pocle_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpoclēti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/klhtoi</foreign> (Select); <sense id="n3043.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">among the Ætolians,</quote> <trans><tr>the members of the smaller council</tr>, <tr>a select committee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apocolocyntosis: <entryFree id="n3044" type="greek" key="a^po^co^lo^cynto_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcŏlŏcyntōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pokoloku/ntwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n3044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Metamorphosis into a Pumpkin</hi>, the title of an insipid lampoon written by the philosopher Seneca upon Claudius Cæsar. who, acc. to this title, instead of being transformed to a god, is changed to a pumpkin; cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. pp. 469 and 470; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 284, 7.</sense></entryFree>
apocope: <entryFree id="n3045" type="greek" key="a^po^co^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pokoph/</foreign>, a gram. fig., <sense id="n3045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dropping of a letter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">syllable at the end of a word</hi> (e. g. bonu' for bonus, do for domo), Prob. p. 1438 P.; Don. p. 1772 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 248</bibl> P.; Victor. p. 2499 P.; cf. Wagn. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apocrisiarius: <entryFree id="n3046" type="main" key="a^pocri^si^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpocrĭsĭārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpocrĭsārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)pokrinomai</foreign>, to answer; <foreign lang="greek">a)po/krisis</foreign>, an answer</etym> (late Lat.), <sense id="n3046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delegate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deputy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who performs a duty in the place of another</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">of a high Church officer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> responsalis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Julian.</author> Epit. 6, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 6, 2</bibl>; Hon. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:G. Anim. 1:185" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> G. Anim. 1, 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apocryphus: <entryFree id="n3047" type="greek" key="a^po^cry^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcryphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/krufos</foreign> (eccl. t. = spurious or uncanonical): libri, in the Church fathers, <sense id="n3047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the apocryphal books incorporated with the Bible.</hi></sense></entryFree>
apocynon: <entryFree id="n3048" type="greek" key="a^po^cy^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏcynon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/kunon</foreign> (dog'sbane). <sense id="n3048.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little bone in the left side of the venomous frog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3048.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog's-bane</hi>: Aconitum lycoctonum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 56, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apodes: <entryFree id="n3049" type="main" key="a^po^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏdes</orth>, v. apus.</entryFree>
apodicticus: <entryFree id="n3050" type="greek" key="a^po^di_cti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏdīctĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)podeiktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proving clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="APOL" /></sense></entryFree>
apodixis: <entryFree id="n3051" type="greek" key="a^po^di_xis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏdīxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/deicis</foreign>, <sense id="n3051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conclusive proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstration</hi>, = evidens prebatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 5</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:7 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 7 al.</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
apodosis: <entryFree id="n3052" type="main" key="a^po^do^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏdŏsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/dosis</foreign>, <sense id="n3052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subsequent proposition</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a clause which refers to one preceding</hi> (protasis), <hi rend="ital">by which it is explained;</hi> cf. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apodoti: <entryFree id="n3053" type="main" key="A^po^do_^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpŏdō^ti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apodyterium: <entryFree id="n3054" type="greek" key="a^po^dy_te_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏdȳtērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poduth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n3054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the undressing-room in a bathing-house</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3278</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apogeus: <entryFree id="n3055" type="greek" key="a^po^ge_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏgēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/gaios</foreign>, <sense id="n3055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that comes from the land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apographon: <entryFree id="n3056" type="greek" key="a^po^gra^phon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏgrăphon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/grafon</foreign>, <sense id="n3056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transcript</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a copy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae exemplar, quod apographon vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 125</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 52, 3</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
apolactizo: <entryFree id="n3057" type="greek" key="a^po^lacti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏlactīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)polakti/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n3057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust from one with the foot;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to spurn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn</hi>: apolactizo inimicos omnīs, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apolectus: <entryFree id="n3058" type="greek" key="a^po^lectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏlectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/lektos</foreign> (picked out). <sense id="n3058.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of tunny-fish when not a year old</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3058.1" n="II" level="1"> Apolecti, <hi rend="ital">pieces for salting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut from the tunnyfish of that age</hi> (pelamis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollinar: <entryFree id="n3059" type="main" key="A^polli^nar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollĭnar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>instead of Apollinal from Apollo, like Frutinal, Supercal, Fagutal, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n3059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple dedicated to Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 7</bibl>, where Weissenb. reads <hi rend="ital">Apollinarem;</hi> v. Apollinaris.</sense></entryFree>
apollinaria: <entryFree id="n3060" type="hapax" key="a^polli^na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpollĭnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant commonly called</hi> strychnos, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollinaris: <entryFree id="n3061" type="main" key="A^polli^na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollĭnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Apollo</etym>, <sense id="n3061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacred to Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Apollo.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3061.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinarem (aedem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb.—Hence, Ludi Apollinares, <hi rend="ital">the games celebrated in honor of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the 5th of July</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3061.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3061.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpol-lĭnāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">the herb commonly called hyoscyamus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 140</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3061.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A species of solanum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollineus: <entryFree id="n3062" type="main" key="A^polli^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Apollo</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Delos</tr>, <tr>where Apollo was born and specially honored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æsculapius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:533" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Latona</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: ars, both <hi rend="ital">the art of soothsaying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:264" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 264</bibl>, and <hi rend="ital">that of healing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 155</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
apollo: <entryFree id="n3063" type="main" key="A^pollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype> (earlier <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpello</orth>, <itype>like hemo for homo</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 22</bibl> Müll.; <sense id="n3063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> APOLONES, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1433</bibl>, like salutes, v. salus; <case>dat.</case> APOLLONI, Corp. Inscr. III. 567, APOLENEI, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> I. 167</bibl>, APOLONE, Inscr. Ritschl, Epigr. Suppl. 3, p. 3; <case>abl.</case> APOLONE; the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Apollōnis etc., is often found in MSS., as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 114</bibl>, and even Apollŏnis is found in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 119</bibl>; Neue, Formenl. I. p. 165), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)apo/llwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter and Latona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twinbrother of Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and god of the sun. On account of his omniscience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">god of divination; on account of his lightnings</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">be/lh</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">god of archery</hi> (hence represented with quiver and dart), <hi rend="ital">and of the pestilence caused by heat;</hi> but, since his priests were the first physicians, also <hi rend="ital">god of the healing art;</hi> and since he communicated oracles in verse, <hi rend="ital">god of poetry and music</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presiding over the Muses</hi>, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:61 sq" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 61 sq.</bibl> In more ancient times, represented as a protecting deity, by a conical pillar in the streets and highways (Apollo Agyieus, v. Agyieus and Müll. Denkm. 2). In the class. period of the arts, represented with weapons, the cithara, a crown of laurel, etc., with hair commonly flowing down upon his neck, but sometimes collected together and fastened up (<foreign lang="greek">a)kerseko/mhs</foreign>), as a blooming youth (<foreign lang="greek">meira/kion</foreign>); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. Archaeol. §§ 359 and 360. The laurel-tree was sacred to him,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:91" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 91</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, arbor Phoebi,</quote> <trans><tr>the laurel-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. arbor.—After the battle at Actium, Augustus there consecrated a temple to Apollo; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Apollo Actiacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 715</bibl></cit>, and Actius Phoebus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:6:67" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 6, 67</bibl> (cf. Strabo, 10, 451, and v. Actium and Actius):<pb n="139" /> <cb n="APOL" />  Pythius Apollo, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>: crinitus Apollo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignos et Apolline crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis nomen est Graecum, quem solem esse volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinem Delium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinem morbos depellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcher,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:445" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3063.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3063.2" n="A" level="2"> Apollinis urbs magna, <hi rend="ital">a town in Upper Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Apollonopolis, now the village <hi rend="ital">Edju</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 60</bibl>; cf. Mann. Afr. I. 328.—</sense><sense id="n3063.3" n="B" level="2"> Apollinis promontorium. </sense><sense id="n3063.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In Zeugitana in Africa</hi>, a mile east of Utica, now <hi rend="ital">Cape Gobeah</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Farina</hi> (previously called promontorium pulchrum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl>; cf. Mann. Afr. II. 293.—</sense><sense id="n3063.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In Mauretania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3063.6" n="C" level="2"> Apollinis oppidum, <hi rend="ital">a town in the eastern part of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3063.7" n="D" level="2"> Apollinis Phaestii portus, <hi rend="ital">a harbor in the territory of Locri Ozolœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3063.8" n="E" level="2"> Apollinis Libystini fanum, <hi rend="ital">a place in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fano</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollodorus: <entryFree id="n3064" type="main" key="A^pollo^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)apollodwros</foreign>. <sense id="n3064.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollŏdōrēi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">his pupils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:18 al" default="NO">3, 1, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3064.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished grammarian of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a work on mythology still extant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3064.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Academic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3064.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tyrant of Cassandrea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollonia: <entryFree id="n3065" type="main" key="A^pollo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)apollwnia</foreign>. <sense id="n3065.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several celebrated towns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3065.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3065.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3065.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Pontus Euxinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 18, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3065.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3065.5" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3065.6" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Cyrenaica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8 al" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3065.7" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3065.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpol-lōnĭātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Apollonia</hi> (in Crete): <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes Apolloniates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Apollonia</hi> (in Caria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 109</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Illyria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 238</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3065.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">plur. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Apollonia</hi> (in Illyrĭa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 100</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3065.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Apollonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Apollonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas (in Sicily),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭen-ses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3065.11" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: bitumen, <hi rend="ital">dug in the neighborhood of Apollonia</hi> (in Epirus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollonidenses: <entryFree id="n3066" type="main" key="A^pollo_ni^denses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭdenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Apollonis in Lydia</hi> (<hi rend="ital">between Pergamus and Sardes</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollonides: <entryFree id="n3067" type="main" key="A^pollo_ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3067.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ruler of Chios in the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3067.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Greek graver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 4, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3067.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writer in the time of Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apollonius: <entryFree id="n3068" type="main" key="A^pollo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpollōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)apollw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n3068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished rhetorician in Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apologatio: <entryFree id="n3069" type="greek" key="a^po^lo^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏlŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">a)po/logos</foreign>, with the Lat. ending, atio</etym>, <sense id="n3069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narration in the manner of Æsop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apologeticus: <entryFree id="n3070" type="greek" key="A^po^lo^ge_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpŏlŏgētĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pologhtiko/s</foreign> (suitable for defence; sc. liber), <sense id="n3070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Apology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a treatise by Tertullian in defence of Christianity.</hi></sense></entryFree>
apologia: <entryFree id="n3071" type="greek" key="a^po^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apology</hi>, Hier. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6 al.</bibl> —Also, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Apuleius of Madaura;</hi> cf. Bähr, Gesch. Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 411; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 362.</sense></entryFree>
apologo: <entryFree id="n3072" type="greek" key="a^po^lo^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏlŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pole/gw</foreign>, <sense id="n3072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurn</hi> (only once in Seneca): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse illum apologavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apologus: <entryFree id="n3073" type="greek" key="a^po^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pologos</foreign>. <sense id="n3073.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A narrative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apologum agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 38</bibl> and 64.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n3073.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fable after the manner of Æsop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an apologue'</hi> narrationes apologorum, Cic. <cb n="APOS" /> de Or. 2, 66, 264; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 17</bibl>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aponus: <entryFree id="n3074" type="main" key="A^po^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/ponos</foreign> (pain-curing). <sense id="n3074.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">medicinal fountain in the vicinity of Padua</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bagni d' Albano</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patavinorum aquae calidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aponi fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aponi fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 39</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, 91.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3074.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpŏ-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aponian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:62:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: Aponinus, dub. in Vop. Firm. Sat. c. 3.</sense></entryFree>
apophasis: <entryFree id="n3075" type="main" key="a^po^pha^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏphăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/fasis</foreign> (denial), rhet. fig., <sense id="n3075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whereby one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">answers himself</hi>, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apophlegmatismos: <entryFree id="n3076" type="greek" key="a^po^phlegma^tismos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏphlegmătismos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poflegmatismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remedy for expelling phlegm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an expectorant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:4" default="NO">2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apophoreta: <entryFree id="n3077" type="greek" key="a^po^pho^re_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏphŏrēta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pofo/rhta</foreign> (to be borne away), <sense id="n3077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presents which guests received at table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially at the Saturnalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry home with them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 75</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">which candidates distributed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:87 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 87 al.</bibl>—Also, <hi rend="ital">title of the fourteenth book of the epigrams of Martial.</hi></sense></entryFree>
apophygis: <entryFree id="n3078" type="greek" key="a^po^phy^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏphygis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pofugh</foreign>; in archit., <sense id="n3078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the curve of a column at top</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bottom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the apophyge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apoplecticus: <entryFree id="n3079" type="greek" key="a^po^ple_cti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏplēctĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏplēctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poplhktiko/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">a)po/plhktos</foreign>, med. t., <sense id="n3079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apoplectic</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 14, n. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
apoplexia: <entryFree id="n3080" type="greek" key="a^po^ple_xi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏplēxĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-xis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poplhcia</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">a)po/plhcis</foreign>, med. t., <sense id="n3080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apoplexy;</hi> form apoplexia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5</bibl>.—Form apoplexis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 53</bibl>; Firm. Math. 3, 7, n. 8.</sense></entryFree>
apoproegmenon: <entryFree id="n3081" type="greek" key="a^po^pro^e_gme^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏprŏēgmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poprohgme/non</foreign>; in the philos, lang. of the Stoics, <sense id="n3081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is to be rejected</hi> (opp. proegmenon): <cit><quote lang="la">puto concedi nobis oportere, ut Graeco verbo utamur, si quando minus occurret Latinum, ne hoc ephippiis et acratophoris potius quam proëgmenis et apoproëgmenis concedatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apopsis: <entryFree id="n3082" type="greek" key="a^popsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpopsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/poyis</foreign> (far-sight), <sense id="n3082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eminence that furnishes an extensive view</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Fer. Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Fer. Als. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apor: <entryFree id="n3083" type="main" key="apor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">apor</orth>, <itype>a form of apud</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
aporia: <entryFree id="n3084" type="greek" key="a^po^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pori)a</foreign>, <sense id="n3084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrassment</hi>, with the idea of confusion, disorder: <cit><quote lang="la">aporia hominis in cogitatu illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 27, 5</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 21, 3 al.</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
aporiatio: <entryFree id="n3085" type="main" key="a^po^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aporior</etym>, <sense id="n3085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vacillation of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aporior: <entryFree id="n3086" type="greek" key="a^po^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pore/w</foreign>, <sense id="n3086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacillate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:59:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 59, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Cor. 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aposcopeuon: <entryFree id="n3087" type="greek" key="a^posco^peuo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăposcŏpeuōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poskopeu/wn</foreign> (looking far off), <sense id="n3087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a painting by Antiphilus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which a satyr is represented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with his hand shading his eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking at something far off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 138</bibl> Hard., Jan, where others read <hi rend="ital">aposcopon.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aposiopesis: <entryFree id="n3088" type="greek" key="a^po^si^o_pe_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏsĭōpēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)posiw/phsis</foreign>, <sense id="n3088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking off in the midst of a speech</hi>, a rhet. fig. (in pure Lat., reticentia, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 54</bibl> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 51 al.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
aposphragisma: <entryFree id="n3089" type="greek" key="a^posphra_gisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăposphrāgisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)posfra/gisma</foreign>, <sense id="n3089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the figure engraved upon a signet-ring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
aposplenos: <entryFree id="n3090" type="greek" key="a^po^sple_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏsplēnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)po/-splhn</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n3090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rosemary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apostasia: <entryFree id="n3091" type="greek" key="a^posta^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)postasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a departure from one's religion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apostasy</hi>, Salv. Gub. Dei, 6, p. 128; Aug. c. Jul. 56.</sense></entryFree>
apostata: <entryFree id="n3092" type="greek" key="a^posta^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)posta/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n3092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apostate</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n3092.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 138</bibl>; Cod. Th. 16, 7, 1. —</sense><sense id="n3092.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicked man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dicit regi, apostata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job. 34, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo apostata, vir inutilis etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Prov. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apostaticus: <entryFree id="n3093" type="greek" key="a^posta^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)postatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to apostasy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apostatizing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 375</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apostato: <entryFree id="n3094" type="greek" key="a^posta^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostăto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)postate/w</foreign>, <sense id="n3094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to forsake one's religion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to apostatize</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">apostatare a Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apostatare faciunt sapientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl>. <cb n="APPA" /></sense></entryFree>
apostatrix: <entryFree id="n3095" type="main" key="a^posta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>apostato</etym>, <sense id="n3095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that apostatizes</hi> (eccl. Lat.); <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apostema: <entryFree id="n3096" type="greek" key="a^poste_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)posthma</foreign> (separation), the separation of corrupt matter into an ulcer, <sense id="n3096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abscess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imposthume</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:217" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 15, 61, § 217</bibl></sense></entryFree>
apostolatus: <entryFree id="n3097" type="main" key="a^posto^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostŏlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>apostolus</etym>, <sense id="n3097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of an apostle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apostleship</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 1, 5 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apostolicus: <entryFree id="n3098" type="greek" key="a^posto^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)postolikos</foreign>, <sense id="n3098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to an apostle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apostolic</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. adv. Haer. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpostŏlĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the pupils and friends of the Apostles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. adv. Haer 32</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the name of a Christian sect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 8, 5, p. 257</bibl> Lind. al</sense></entryFree>
apostolus: <entryFree id="n3099" type="greek" key="a^posto^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/stolos</foreign> (sent). <sense id="n3099.0" n="I" level="1"> In the jurists, <hi rend="ital">a notice sent to a higher tribunal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:106" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3099.1" n="II" level="1"> In the Vulg. and Church fathers, <hi rend="ital">an Apostle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Rom 1, 1</bibl> et persaep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. adv. Haer. 20</bibl>; Prud. Ham. v 508.</sense></entryFree>
apostrophe: <entryFree id="n3100" type="greek" key="a^postro^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostrŏphē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)postrofh/</foreign> (a turning away), <sense id="n3100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhetorical figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the speaker turns from the judges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">his hearers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and addresses some other person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an apostrophe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:24" default="NO">9, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, p. 171</bibl> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9 al.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
apostrophos: <entryFree id="n3101" type="greek" key="a^postro^pho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpostrŏphŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-phus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/strofos</foreign>; in gram., <sense id="n3101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mark of elision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apostrophe</hi>, Don. p. 1742 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 430</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1287</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
apotelesma: <entryFree id="n3102" type="greek" key="a^po^te^lesma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏtĕlesma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pote/lesma</foreign> (effect), <sense id="n3102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the influence of the stars upon human destiny</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 5, 18.</sense></entryFree>
apotheca: <entryFree id="n3103" type="greek" key="a^po^the_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏthēca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poqh/kh</foreign> [corrupted in Ital. to bottega, in Fr. to boutique, and in Germ. to Bude = booth, shop], <sense id="n3103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where things are put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laid up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a repository</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storehouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magazine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warehouse</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27</bibl>, so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl>; esp. for wine, <hi rend="ital">a store-room</hi> (not wine-cellar, since the ancients kept their wine in the upper part of the house), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 16, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 4, 6, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 21</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 236</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also for oil: apothecae olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 27, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for corn: apothecae frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:32:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 32, 28</bibl></cit>; ib. Joel, 1, 17; <cit><quote lang="la">for armor, equipments: omnes apothecas supellectilis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 39, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
apothecarius: <entryFree id="n3104" type="main" key="a^po^the_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏthēcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>apotheca</etym>, <sense id="n3104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warehouseman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clerk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:58:12:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 58, 12, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apotheco: <entryFree id="n3105" type="hapax" key="a^po^the_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏthēco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay up in a storehouse</hi>, Ven. Ep. praef. Carm. 6, 1, 5.</sense></entryFree>
apotheosis: <entryFree id="n3106" type="greek" key="a^po^the^o_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏthĕōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)poqe/wsis</foreign>, <sense id="n3106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deification</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 34</bibl>: Apotheosis Christi, <hi rend="ital">title of a poem of Prudentius;</hi> v. Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 430, 4.</sense></entryFree>
apothesis: <entryFree id="n3107" type="main" key="a^po^the^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏthĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, i. q. apophygis, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
apoxyomenos: <entryFree id="n3108" type="main" key="A^poxy_o^me^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăpoxȳŏmĕnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)pocuo/menos</foreign> (se destringens, rubbing himself off, i. e. in the bath), <sense id="n3108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a statue by Lysippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apozema: <entryFree id="n3109" type="greek" key="a^po^ze^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpŏzĕma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)po/zema</foreign>, <sense id="n3109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decoction</hi>, Aem. Mac. Herb. c. de Apio.</sense></entryFree>
apozymo: <entryFree id="n3110" type="main" key="a^pozy_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăpozȳmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)po/-zumo/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n3110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make ferment</hi> (in pure Lat., fermento), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 119</bibl></sense></entryFree>
appango: <entryFree id="n3111" type="hapax" key="appango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pango</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten to</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
apparamentum: <entryFree id="n3112" type="gloss" key="appa^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>apparo</etym>, <sense id="n3112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is prepared</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2332</bibl>; cf. apparator.</sense></entryFree>
apparate: <entryFree id="n3113" type="main" key="appa^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. apparo, <sense id="n3113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
apparatio: <entryFree id="n3114" type="main" key="appa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n3114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [apparo], <hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (rare) adparatio popularium munerum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 10</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg> apparatio atque artificiosa diligentia, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18</bibl>, so Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; cf. apparatus, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
apparator: <entryFree id="n3115" type="gloss" key="appa^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that prepares</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2325</bibl>; cf. apparamentum.</sense></entryFree>
apparatrix: <entryFree id="n3116" type="main" key="appa^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>apparator</etym>, <sense id="n3116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that prepares</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>. <pb n="140" /> <cb n="APPA" /></sense></entryFree>
apparatus: <entryFree id="n3117" type="main" key="appa^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from apparo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3118" type="main" key="appa^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>apparo</etym>. <sense id="n3118.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">getting ready;</hi> abstr. (class.; but, except in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 1</bibl>, scarcely to be found in any poet): <cit><quote lang="la">requiro omnem totius operis designationem atque adparatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius belli instrumentum et adparatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum ac munitionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n3118.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provision;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">equipment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparatus</hi> (<hi rend="ital">instruments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">machines</hi>, etc.). </sense><sense id="n3118.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in reliquo Darei adparatu,</quote> <trans><tr>movables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">argenteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit>: apparatus (<hi rend="ital">military engines</hi>) et munitiones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 41 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma promta ex regio apparatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus oppugnandarum urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 47</bibl>.—Also of men: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliorum apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3118.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">magnificent preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pomp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifici adparatus vitaeque cultus cum elegantiā et copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto festum diem, argento, veste, omni apparatu ornatuque virendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio adparatu accepti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10</bibl></cit>;
