so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also of the pomp and parade attending public spectacles or other festive celebrations: ludorum venationumque adparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl> (cf. apparo).</sense></entryFree>
apparentia: <entryFree id="n3119" type="main" key="appa_renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appārentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>appareo</etym>, <sense id="n3119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a becoming visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> (only late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the external appearance</hi>: bona, Firm. Math. 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
appareo: <entryFree id="n3120" type="main" key="appa_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pārĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., B. and K.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Lachm., Merk., Weissenb., Halm, Rib.), <itype>ui, itum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come in sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make one's appearance</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n3120.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego adparebo domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille bonus vir nusquam adparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 25</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:989" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 989</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem contra speculum ponas, apparet imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 157</bibl></cit>: unde tandem adpares, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 706</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus mecum una demersus rursus adparuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 68</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lux appareret (Dinter, adpeteret),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sulcis acies apparuit hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparent rari nantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 118</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:59 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 59 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis ille, qui Sullae adparuit immolanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quís numquam candente dies adparuit ortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—Once in Varro with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: quod adparet ad agricolas, R. R. 1, 40.—</sense><sense id="n3120.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro pretio facio, ut opera adpareat Mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac sis nunc promissa adpareant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud apparere unum,</quote> <trans><tr>that this only is apparent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 877</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi merces apparet? i. e. illud quod pro tantā mercede didiceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo studiosius opprimitur et absconditur, eo magis eminet et apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galbae orationes evanuerunt, vix jam ut appareant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet adhuc vetus mde cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 444</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 734</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus angustis animosus atque fortis appare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lamentamur, non apparere labores Nostros,</quote> <trans><tr>are not noticed</tr>, <tr>considered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 224</bibl></cit>, so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 250</bibl> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 161</bibl> and 162.—Hence, apparens (opp. latens), <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tympana non apparentia Obstrepuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparentia vitia curanda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3120.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: res apparet, and far more freq. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> apparet with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the thing</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">it</hi>) <hi rend="ital">is evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">dh=lo/n e)sti, fai/netai</foreign> (objective certainty, while videtur. <foreign lang="greek">dokei=</foreign>, designates subjective belief, Web. Uebungssch. 258): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio adparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res adparet, Ter Ad. 5, 9, 7: apparet id etiam caeco, Liv 32, 34. cui non id apparere, id actum esse. etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo adparet antiquior origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:197 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 197 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adparet servom nunc esse domini pauperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dissimulat, apparet esse commotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: apparet atque exstat, <cb n="APPA" /> utrum simus earum (artium) rudes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid rectum sit, adparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive confictum est, ut apparet, sive, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo adparet antiquiorem hanc fuisse scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:153 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 44, § 153 al.</bibl></cit>—Also with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas impendere jam apparebat omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; and, by attraction, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dh=lo/s e)sti</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra nobis ita data sunt, ut ad quandam rationem vivendi data esse adpareant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 23</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Otto: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet ita degenerāsse Nero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>; or without the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with an <pos>adj.</pos> as predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">apparebat atrox cum plebe certamen (sc. fore, imminere, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3120.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To appear as servant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a lictor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scribe</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wait upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serve;</hi> cf. apparitor (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes diis adparento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum septem annos Philippo apparuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum appareret aedilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">lictores apparent consulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegis accensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>: tibi appareo atque aeditumor in templo tuo, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis ad solium Apparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 850</bibl></cit> (= praestant ad obsequium, Serv.).</sense></entryFree>
apparesco: <entryFree id="n3121" type="main" key="appa_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pāresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n3121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [appareo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to appear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appario: <entryFree id="n3122" type="hapax" key="appa^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-părĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gain besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Appareret spatium caeli domus,</quote> <trans><tr>gain a great space</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1110</bibl></cit> Lachm.</sense></entryFree>
apparitio: <entryFree id="n3123" type="main" key="appa_ri^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appārĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>appareo, III.</etym>. <sense id="n3123.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A serving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longā adparitione singularem fidem cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 75" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3123.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">household</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domestics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex necessariis adparitionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apparitor: <entryFree id="n3124" type="main" key="appa_ri^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appārĭtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a public servant</hi> (<hi rend="ital">lictor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priest</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. ad. Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4; Auct. B. Afr. 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 53 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3202</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1896</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2462</bibl>; 2975; 4921 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
apparitura: <entryFree id="n3125" type="hapax" key="appa_ri^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appārĭtūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a serving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
apparo: <entryFree id="n3126" type="main" key="appa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-păro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Fleck., Bait.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Lachm., Kayser, Weissenb., Halm), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make ready for something</hi> (esp. with effort, care, expense), <hi rend="ital">to put in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n3126.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui prandium adparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam adparare, Ter Heaut. 1, 1, 74: convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare et apparare convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum apparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos magnificentissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8</bibl></cit> (cf. apparatus, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad caedem faciendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum armaque vi summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 21</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostes bellum apparatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sestium adparabantur crimina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3126.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hoc consilium capio et hanc fabricam adparo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi auxilium adparetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">delinire adparas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meam exscindere gentem apparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:670" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traicere ex Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 47</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (cf Ruhnk. Dict. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 19</bibl>; Corte ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl>, Bremi ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">dum adparatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in apparando esset occupatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eriperes, adparabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—Se apparare with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> in Plaut.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sese parere adparent legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">appărā-tus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, pr. <hi rend="ital">prepared;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n3126.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adparatus sum, ut videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adparatus et meditatus ad causam accedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3126.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">well supplied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished with every thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus omnibus instructior rebus et apparatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi> (cf. apparatus, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludi apparatissimi et magnificentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatis accipere epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 4</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatissimae epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatissimum funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9</bibl></cit>: <cb n="APPE" /> munus apparatissimum largissimumque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">too studied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far-felched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labored</hi>: ut non apparata oratio esse videatur, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 7</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verba apparata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (cf. apparatio).— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">appărātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et edit et bibit opipare sane et adparate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi Romani scaenici eo anno magnifice apparateque facti (sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: Potes apparatius cenare apud multos; <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam hilarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appectoro: <entryFree id="n3127" type="hapax" key="appecto^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pectŏro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pectus</etym>, <sense id="n3127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press to the breast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 26</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
appellatio: <entryFree id="n3128" type="main" key="appella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. appello</etym>. <sense id="n3128.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going to one</hi> in order to accost or make a request of him (not found in earlier Lat.). </sense><sense id="n3128.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An address</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an accosting</hi>: hanc nactus appellationis causam, <hi rend="ital">this opportunity for an address</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appeal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3128.2" n="B" level="2"> In judicial lang., t. t., <hi rend="ital">an appeal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessit appellatio tribunorum, i. e. ad tribunos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellationem et tribunicium auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio provocatioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes appellationes a judicibus ad Senatum fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 90 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3128.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3128.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A calling by name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a naming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nominum ullorum intereos appellatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, meton. syn. with nomen, <hi rend="ital">name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">title</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appellation</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluit appellatione hac inani nobis esse par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum appellationes venales erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non aura, non procella, sed mares appellatione quoque ipsā venti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse rem publicam, appellationem modo,</quote> <trans><tr>a mere name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3128.5" n="B" level="2"> In gram. </sense><sense id="n3128.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pronunciation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas vocis et lenis appellatio litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl> (cf. 2. appello, II. E.).—</sense><sense id="n3128.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A substantive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl>, and Scaurus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 306</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
appellativus: <entryFree id="n3129" type="main" key="appella_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appellātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>; in gram., <sense id="n3129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">appellative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to a species</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen (opp. nomen proprium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 126</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 579</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
appellator: <entryFree id="n3130" type="main" key="appella_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appellātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that appeals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appellant</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Cod. Th. 11, 31, 3.</sense></entryFree>
appellatorius: <entryFree id="n3131" type="main" key="appella_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appellātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>appellator</etym>, <sense id="n3131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to an appellant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>within which an appeal is allowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:5:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 11, 30, 2.</sense></entryFree>
appellito: <entryFree id="n3132" type="main" key="appelli^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appellĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>2. appello</etym>, <sense id="n3132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to name often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be accustomed to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">name</hi> (only post-Aug.): montem Caelium appellitatum a Caele Vibennā, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 279</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
appello: <entryFree id="n3133" type="main" key="appello1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pello</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Fleck., Halm (in Tac.); <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, Merk., B. and K., Rib., Weissenb., Halm (in Nep.), <itype>pŭli, pulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3133.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n3133.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, with the <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3133.3" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ignotum arbitrum me adpellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum ad aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad litora juvencos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 353</bibl></cit>: visum in somnis pastorem ad me appellere, <hi rend="ital">to drive toward me</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the herd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the flock</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres ad opera appellebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.4" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.5" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hinc me digressum vestris deus appulit oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 715</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.6" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>: quo numquam pennis appellunt Corpora saucae Cornices, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 752</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.7" n="e" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: dant operam, ut quam primum appellant, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 238, 28</bibl>: postquam paulo appulit unda (corpus), <hi rend="ital">drove a little toward</hi> me, <hi rend="ital">brought near</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:717 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 717 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3133.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animum ad aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad scribendum adpulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 15</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">to bring into any condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti viginti minae me ad mortem adpulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>drove me to destruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.9" n="II. A." level="1"> Esp. freq. as a nautical t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct a ship somewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to land</hi> (in Cic. only in this signif.); constr.: appellere navem, nave, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass.;</hi> also navis appellit, or appellitur (cf. applico, II.). </sense><sense id="n3133.10" n="a" level="4"> With navem. <pb n="141" /> <cb n="APPE" /> abitu appellant huc ad molem nostram naviculam, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 238, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Persae classem ad Delum appulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ille ad eam ripam naves appulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit> Wernsd.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad villam nostram navis appelleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum in Italiam classem appulisse constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves appulsae ad muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3133.11" n="b" level="4"> With nave: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Rhegium onerariā nave appulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Gron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act. absol.</hi>: huc appelle, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad insulam appulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad litus appulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad Rhodum appulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.13" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios ad Siciliam appulsos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae suorum appulsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3133.14" n="e" level="4"> Seldom in a <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">navis adpellit,</quote> <trans><tr>comes to land</tr>, <tr>arrives at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanici triremis Chaucorum terram adpulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrina navis Dertosam appulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellere aliquem: me vestris deus appulit oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 715</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 377</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 616</bibl>: quae vis te immanibus applicat oris).—</sense><sense id="n3133.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">timide, tamquam ad aliquem libidinis scopulum, sic tuam mentem ad philosophiam appulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tuas umquam rationes ad eos scopulos appulisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3134" type="main" key="appello2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appello</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Ritschl), āvi, ātum, 1 (<sense id="n3134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subj. perf.</hi> appellāssis = appellaveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 15</bibl>), orig. <pos>v. n.</pos>, as a secondary form of the preced. (cf.: jungere, jugare), <hi rend="ital">to drive to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go to in order to accost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admonish</hi>, etc.; like adire, aggredi; hence like these constr. as <pos>v. a.</pos> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to accost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">address</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call upon</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n3134.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. adgrediar hominem, adpellabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedam atque adpellabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeamus, adpellemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:22:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 22, 5, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te volo adpellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ore appellabo patrem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl> (9), 22: Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 238, 23</bibl> aliquem hilari vultu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem verbo graviore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos superbius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines asperius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi a Virdumaro appellatus,</quote> <trans><tr>accosted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adherbalis appellandi copia non fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22, 5</bibl></cit> milites alius alium laeti appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 8</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40</bibl>: senatu coram appellato, Suet Ner. 41; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 29 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec audet Appellare virum virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:682 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 682 al.</bibl></cit>—Also <hi rend="ital">to address by letter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris nos litteris appellato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3134.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp </sense><sense id="n3134.3" n="A. 1." level="1"> Freq. with the access. idea of entreating, soliciting, <hi rend="ital">to approach with a request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoke</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos etiam atque etiam imploro et appello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 188</bibl></cit> quem enim alium appellem? quem obtester? quem implorem? <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem praeter te appellet, habebat neminem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo accedam aut quos appellem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatus est a C. Flavio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatis de re publicā Patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3134.4" n="2" level="3"> Aliquem de aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to address one in order to incite him to something</hi> (<hi rend="ital">bad</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de proditione, Liv 26, 38, 4: de stupro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 98</bibl></cit>.—Also without <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3134.5" n="3" level="3"> In judic. language, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to appeal to one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to call upon him for assistance</hi> (in the class. period always with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> also in Pandect. Lat. constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">procurator a praetore tribunos appellare ausus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni igitur appellabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praetor appellabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volero appellat tribunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. 10: mox et ipse appellato demum collegio (<hi rend="ital">after he had appealed to the college of the tribunes</hi>), obtinuit, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarii ad imperatorem appellārunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3134.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To address</hi> in order to demand something, esp. the payment of money, <hi rend="ital">to dun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tulliola tuum munusculum flagitat et me ut sponsorem appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with de pecuniā: appellatus es de pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; and without <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: magnā pecuniā appellabaris a creditoribus,<cb n="APPE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl>; Alphius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus in Cretā gignitur etiam non appellato solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 142</bibl></cit>.—Later also appellare rem, <hi rend="ital">to demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claim something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem appellas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3134.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complain of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to summon before a court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne alii plectantur, alii ne appellentur quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem stupri causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:11 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 11 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3134.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To accost by any appellation</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">centurionibus nominatim appellatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>); hence, <hi rend="ital">to call by name</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to term</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entitle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">announce as something</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">prosagoreu/w</foreign>, and in Heb. <foreign />, to call, and also to name; <hi rend="ital">appellare</hi> gives a new predicate to the subject, while <hi rend="ital">nominare</hi> only designates it by name, without a qualifying word; cf. Hab. Syn. 958; Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">vir ego tuus sim? ne me adpella falso nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 181</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>, pater a gnatis ne dulcibus umquam Appelletur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">O Spartace, quem enim te potius appellem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum te sapientem appellant et existimant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos viros bonos, ut habiti sunt, sic appellandos putemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fruges Cererem appellamus, vinum autem Bacchum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N D 2, 23, 60</bibl></cit> suo quamque rem nomine appellare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ab suis appellatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. G 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me subditum et ex pellice genitum appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>. quem nautae appellant Lichan, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 229</bibl> victorem appellat Acesten, <hi rend="ital">declares him victor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:540 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 540 al.</bibl>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to call by name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non appello hoc loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sest 50, 108</bibl></cit>: multi appellandi laedendique sunt, id Verr 2, 1, 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">appellare auctores,</quote> <trans><tr>to declare</tr>, <tr>name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos saepe nutu significationeque appello,</quote> <trans><tr>make known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n3134.9" n="E" level="2"> Appellare litteras, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 133</bibl> (v. appellatio).</sense></entryFree>
appendeo: <entryFree id="n3135" type="main" key="appendeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appendeo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">v</orth> appendo.</entryFree>
appendicium: <entryFree id="n3136" type="main" key="appendi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appendĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a post-class. form kindr with appendix, q. v., <sense id="n3136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appendage</hi>, Hier Ep 10.</sense></entryFree>
appendicula: <entryFree id="n3137" type="hapax" key="appendi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appendĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>appendix</etym>, <sense id="n3137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small appendage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appendix: <entryFree id="n3138" type="main" key="appendix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appendix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <sense id="n3138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> (acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> Müll., earlier <orth extent="full" lang="la">ampendix</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>; v. ampendices) [appendo]. </sense><sense id="n3138.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which hangs to</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">an appendage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3138.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 169, 10.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n3138.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplement</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">accession to</hi> any thing, Varr R. R. 1, 16, 1; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 2</bibl>: vidit enim appendicem animi esse corpus, * Cic. Hort. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 42, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigua appendix Etrusci belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit> (cf. accessio): <cit><quote lang="la">appendices majoris muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appendices Olcadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3138.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thorny shrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the barberrybush</hi>: Berberis vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 70, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appendo: <entryFree id="n3139" type="main" key="appendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pendo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Jan), endi, ensum, 3 (kindr, with <orth extent="full" lang="la">appendeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n3139.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hang</hi> something <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to suspend on</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Deus) appendit terram super nihilum,</quote> <trans><tr>hangeth the earth on nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3139.1" n="II" level="1"> Commonly <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> something <hi rend="ital">to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> (cf. pendo) </sense><sense id="n3139.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi optimā fide sua omnia concessit, adnumeravit, appendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque trades, numera et appende,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appendit pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut appendantur, non numerentur pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum omni auro appenso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentum auri appendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appensum est argentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr 8, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cenis Caesaris sex milia numero murenarum mutua adpendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 55, 81, § 171</bibl></cit> Jan; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 34</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3139.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>: non verba me adnumerare lectori putavi oportere, sed tamquam appendere, <hi rend="ital">to have regard not to their number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but to their weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">appendit corda Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appensor: <entryFree id="n3140" type="main" key="appensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appensor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>appendo</etym>, <sense id="n3140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that weighs out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weigher</hi> (only in Augustin.): verborum, Cres. 3, 73; so Tract. in Joan. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="APPE" /></sense></entryFree>
appensus: <entryFree id="n3141" type="main" key="appensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of appendo.</entryFree>
appertineo: <entryFree id="n3142" type="main" key="apperti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pertĭnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to belong to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appertain to;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, Innoc. p. 221 Goes.; p. 232 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
appetens: <entryFree id="n3143" type="main" key="appe^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>appeto</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
appetenter: <entryFree id="n3144" type="main" key="appe^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. appeto, <sense id="n3144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
appetentia: <entryFree id="n3145" type="main" key="appe^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>appeto</etym>, <sense id="n3145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a longing after</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">appetite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpetentia cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalium artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 15" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 15</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido effrenatam (efficit) adpetentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
appetibilis: <entryFree id="n3146" type="main" key="appe^ti_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtībĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desirable</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appetisso: <entryFree id="n3147" type="hapax" key="appe^tisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtisso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n3147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to strive for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek earnestly</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 237, 22</bibl> dub. (Ribbeck, Trag. Rel. p. 132, reads <hi rend="ital">appetis</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
appetitio: <entryFree id="n3148" type="main" key="appe^ti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtītĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, * <sense id="n3148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grasping at</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">a reaching after.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3148.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpetitio solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3148.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3148.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a passionate longing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striving for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong desire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi> (most freq. in Cic.): aliter adpetitio (eam enim esse volumus <foreign lang="greek">o(rmh/n</foreign>), quā ad agendum impellimur et id adpetimus, quod est visum, moveri non potest, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n3148.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a desire for food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appetite</hi> (cf. abstinentia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appetitor: <entryFree id="n3149" type="main" key="appe^ti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that strives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">longs for something</hi> (eccl. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alienorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 4, 15; <cit><quote lang="la">boni linteaminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appetitus: <entryFree id="n3150" type="main" key="appe^ti_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of appeto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3151" type="main" key="appe^ti_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">appĕtītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>appeto</etym>. * <sense id="n3151.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An onset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprimebat barbaricos appetitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n3151.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3151.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A passionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager longing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desire for</hi> a thing (in the class. per. perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">adpetitus voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub te erit appetitus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 21, 16</bibl>.—Hence, without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n3151.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faculty of desire</hi>: duplex est vis animorum atque naturae: una pars in adpetitu posita est, quae est <foreign lang="greek">o(rmh/</foreign> Graece, quae hominem huc atque illuc rapit, altera in ratione, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 101</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3151.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The passions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appetites</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adpetitus rationi oboediant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
appeto: <entryFree id="n3152" type="main" key="appe^to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ap-pĕto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adp-</orth>, Lachm., Baiter, Weissenb., Halm; <orth extent="full" lang="la">app-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Kayser), īvi or <itype>ii, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (class.; in poetry rare); <sense id="n3152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strive after</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to try to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grasp after</hi> (syn.: adfecto, nitor in aliquid). </sense><sense id="n3152.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3152.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">solem manibus adpetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placentam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 183</bibl></cit>; so, adpetere manum osculis, <hi rend="ital">to seize upon the hand with kisses</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in order to kiss it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 250</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, appeti, of old men whose hands one seizes and kisses: haec enim ipsa sunt honorabilia, salutari, adpeti, decedi, adsurgi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>; hence (like accedere), <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come somewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>.— Of things without life: mare terram adpetens, <hi rend="ital">pressing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rushing on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescebat interim urbs, munitionibus alia atque alia adpetendo loca,</quote> <trans><tr>by continually advancing farther</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thule, quam hactenus nix et hiems adpetebat,</quote> <trans><tr>only snow and frost had approached</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3152.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seize upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">peto, adgredior, adorior, invado): lapidibus appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro atque insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerum gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila aquaticas aves adpetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:27 al" default="NO">48, 5, 27 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiis omnibus appetitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me amor appetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uxor) falsā suspitione appetitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3152.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <pb n="142" /> <cb n="APPI" /> <hi rend="ital">to strive after earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desire eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi> (syn.: peto, cupio, expeto; opp. declino, aspernor; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): aliut in dies magis adpetitur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bona naturā adpetimus, sic a malis naturā declinamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem non modo non recusem, sed appetam etiam atque deposcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias potentium appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum esse adpetendum, alterum aspernandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:31 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 31 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentium familiaritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ornamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 12 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec abnuendum imperium nec adpetendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 472" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 472</bibl></cit> et saep.—Also of food, <hi rend="ital">to have an appetite for</hi> (cf. appetitio, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">appetitur vilis oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisciculos minutos, caseum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adpetat animus agere semper aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:234" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 234</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3152.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be at hand</hi> (only of time and things having relation to it; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: venio, advenio, adpropinquo, adsum): cum appetit meridies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies adpetebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
